intro: Microstylis segaarensis, commonly known as the Segara microstylis, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are typically greenish or brownish, and it produces small, three-angled berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
